Package socialmedia

Class Post

java.lang.Object
socialmedia.Post
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Comment, EndorsementPost
public class Post extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a post on the platform.
See Also:

    • Post

      public Post(Account account, String message)
      Creates an instance of the Post object. Assigns a message, an ID and an account to the post object.
      Parameters:
      account - Account that is creating the post
      message - Text contained in the post

      Returns the next sequential ID that will be assigned to the next post that is created
      Returns:
      ID to be used by the next post that is created

    • isEmptyPost

      public boolean isEmptyPost()
      States whether the post is an empty post. An empty post is a post that has been deleted so no longer has a message
      Returns:
      Boolean value stating whether the post is empty or not

    • setNextId

      public static void setNextId(int id)
      Sets the next sequential ID, that will be assinged to the next post that is created, to the value passed in
      Parameters:
      id - The value to assign to nextID

    • setMessage

      public void setMessage(String message)
      Updates the message of the post to provided message
      Parameters:
      message - New text that the post object shows when printed

    • setPostToEmpty

      public void setPostToEmpty()
      Sets the post to be an empty post. If a post is deleted, it is set to empty. Its message is updated to state that it has been deleted. Comments are still linked to the post

    • resetIdCount

      public static void resetIdCount()
      Restets the static ID count of the Post class so that the next post created will have an ID of 1

    • addComment

      public void addComment(Comment c)
      Add a comment to the list of comments about the post
      Parameters:
      c - Comment object about the post

    • addEndorsementPost

      public void addEndorsementPost(EndorsementPost e)
      Add an endorsement post to the list of endorsements about the post
      Parameters:
      e - Endorsement object about the post

    • removeEndorsement

      public void removeEndorsement(EndorsementPost e)
      Removes a single EndorsementPost object from the list of edorsements stored in a post object
      Parameters:
      e - The EndorsementPost object that is being removed

    • clearEndorsements

      public void clearEndorsements()
      Clears the list of endorsements stored in the post Object

    • validateMessage

      public static void validateMessage(String message) throws InvalidPostException
      Checks that the message meets the requirements to be posted. The message must be less than 100 characters and must not be empty
      Parameters:
      message - Text that is being checked
      Throws:
      InvalidPostException - If the message is empty or if it is longer than 100 characters

    • findPostByID

      public static Post findPostByID(int id, ArrayList<Account> accountList, ArrayList<Post> emptyPostList) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
      Searches through all of the posts stored in accounts and all of the empty posts stored in an emptyPostList. Returns the Post object that has the given ID
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the post to be returned
      accountList - List of accounts stored in SocialMedia
      emptyPostList - List of empty posts
      Returns:
      Post that has the ID that is passed in
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - There is no post that has the given ID

    • findPostByID

      public static Post findPostByID(int id, ArrayList<Account> accountList) throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
      Searches through all of the posts stored in accounts and returns the Post object that has the given ID
      Parameters:
      id - ID of the post to be returned
      accountList - List of accounts stored in SocialMedia
      Returns:
      Post that has the ID that is passed in
      Throws:
      PostIDNotRecognisedException - There is no post that has the given ID

    • formatMessage

      public static StringBuilder formatMessage(String message, int indentLevel, boolean isFirstComment)
      Formats the text to be printed by the showPostChildrenDetails method. Adds |> before the first line and some number of indents before each new line so that the message is indented when printed. If it is the first comment of a post a blank line containing a single | is added about. So if the text passed in is the first comment of a post it returns: 
           |
     | > ID: 1
     Account: user1
     No. endorsements: 0 | No. comments: 0
     This is the first comment
      Parameters:
      message - The description of the post that is being formatted
      indentLevel - The number of times the message is indented
      isFirstComment - Boolean value stating whether the comment is the first comment of a post
      Returns:
      New string which is the indented message with the appropriate symbols | > before the first line

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string containing the information about a post. This includes the ID of the post, the account that the post belongs to and the number of endorsements and number of comments that the post has. It will return a string in the form below. 
       ID: 1
 Account: user1
 No. endorsements: 2 | No. comments: 1
 This is a post

      An empty post, which has been deleted will display a message stating that it has been deleted. 

       ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 The original content was removed from the system and is no longer available.
 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String of information about the post
